content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 1.7 - Executive Order No. 7: Establishing an Advisory Council on Alcoholism

State Regulations
I, Nelson A. Rockefeller, by virtue of the authority vested
in me by the Constitution and laws of the State of New York, and as Governor of
the State of New York, do hereby direct by Executive Order as follows: (1)

There is hereby established within the

Department of Mental Hygiene a council to be known as the Advisory Council on

Alcoholism to consist of the Commissioner of Mental Hygiene and twelve members
to be appointed by the Governor from outside State government who shall be
specially qualified and who shall serve at the pleasure of the Governor. The

Governor shall designate one of the members of the Council as chairman and one
as vice-chairman to serve as such at the pleasure of the Governor. (2)

The Council shall meet at least once in
each month, except in July and August, and special meetings may be held at the
call of the chairman. The Division of Alcoholism in the Department of Mental

Hygiene shall provide housekeeping, secretarial and consultant services for the

Council. (3)

The members of the

Council shall receive no compensation for their services but shall be
reimbursed for all expenses actually and necessarily incurred by them in the
performance of their duties as herein set forth within the amounts made
available by appropriation therefor. (4)

The Council shall have no executive or
appointive duties. It shall advise and assist the Department of Mental Hygiene
in connection with (a) the formulation of a comprehensive plan for the
long-range development, through the utilization of State, local and private
resources, of adequate services and facilities for the prevention and control
of alcoholism and the care, treatment and rehabilitation of alcoholics in this

State, and the revision of such plan from time to time; (b) the development of
unified State programs for the prevention and control of alcoholism and the
care, treatment and rehabilitation of alcoholics; (c) the establishment, encouragement, co-ordination and integration of all areas of research in the
problems of alcoholism; and (d) the assistance and encouragement of local
communities in the establishment and expansion of alcoholism services and
facilities. Signed: Nelson A. Rockefeller

Dated: June 16, 1961
